node.title: Former All Blacks and Wallabies could play for Tonga at 2023 World Cup
node.description: Advocates for Pacific islands rugby have welcomed World Rugby's decision to allow players to switch their international allegiance, hailing it as a game-changer for a region rich in talent but poor in…

node.title: Australia introduces contentious religious anti-discrimination legislation
node.description: Australia today introduced contentious religious anti-discrimination legislation that if approved would allow faith-based organisations to prioritise the hiring and enrolment of people from their…

node.title: Collins and Bridges: MP disputes should allow some natural justice
node.description: Analysis - In the wake of the National Party's unceremonious toppling of leader Judith Collins, former ministerial adviser Brigitte Morten argues the case for utilising natural justice in party…

node.title: Happy Thanksgiving!
node.description: And just remember: Everything’s going to be all right.

node.title: South Carolina Women’s Basketball Soars in Place, Atop the Rankings
node.description: The Gamecocks were already ranked No. 1 when they beat Connecticut, but the victory elevated a sense that Coach Dawn Staley is building a perennial title contender.

node.title: American Academia: The Traditional and the Upstarts
node.description: Readers respond to Ross Douthat’s column about new universities. Also: Fighting vaccine mandates in Florida; a view from Meta.

node.title: The French rush to get booster shots as the government eyes more restrictions.
node.description: The French health minister said the latest wave of cases would be worse than the one during the summer. Adults will need a booster for their health pass to remain valid.

node.title: North Korea Bans Leather Coats To Stop Citizens Emulating Kim's Fashion–Report
node.description: The coats are recognized in the hermit kingdom as "a symbol of power," a source told Radio Free Asia

node.title: Trump Promises 'Wonderful Future Lies Ahead' In Thanksgiving Message
node.description: In a statement released on Thursday, the former president described the holiday season as "a very interesting time in our Country."

node.title: Kariamu Welsh, Pioneer of African Dance Studies, Dies at 72
node.description: Inspired by double Dutch jump rope moves she saw growing up in Brooklyn, she developed an influential dance technique based on archetypes found in African art.

node.title: Why Shouldn’t Housing for the Homeless Be Beautiful?
node.description: An exhibition highlights creative solutions by architects around the world to the problem of homelessness.

node.title: 80-Year-Old 'Mr. Thanksgiving' Hosts Holiday Feast for Thousands in Decades-Long Tradition
node.description: This Thursday marks the 51st year that Bob Vogelbaugh and a team of volunteers will coordinate a Thanksgiving feast to feed roughly 3,000 people.

node.title: Could All Blacks switch to Pacific Island nations?
node.description: Former Samoa halfback Tino Poluleuligaga believes some All Blacks might change allegiances after the next World Cup, now that eligibility rules have been relaxed.
